column4: Does anyone help me with setup CDMA mobile phone and using internet?
Does anyone have experience with setup CDMA mobile phone and internet in ubuntu 9.10?
i have done this with my own phone, but my experience is that it can involve quite a bit of research, depending on your phone.

some phones are supported by default if you plug it in and just look in the NetworkManager Applet's menu. others, like mine, take a little more work. i had to install an extra piece of software on my phone, for example.
I'am will write my situation here
I have installed ubuntu 9.10 and mobile phone Sky IM-6100
system was see my phone automaticaly and starting welcome to setup internet
after setup it was not start connection,

I have installed ubuntu 9.10 and mobile phone Sky IM-6100. System was see my phone automaticaly and starting welcome to setup internet. After setup it was not start connection. I have second OS Windows XP, and now I use it on this.
ok. well i probably won't be much help since you don't seem to be having the same problems with your phone as I had with mine. just curious though, do you have a tethering plan?

I have installed ubuntu 9.10 and mobile phone Sky IM-6100. System was see my phone automaticaly and starting welcome to setup internet. After setup it was not start connection. I have second OS Windows XP, and now I use it on this.
ok. well i probably won't be much help since you don't seem to be having the same problems with your phone as I had with mine. just curious though, do you have a tethering plan?

i see. i'm not going to be able to help much then. i'm sure you've tried this already, but my best advice would be google. i'm guessing it's a problem specific to your phone or network.
sorry i can't halp any more, and good luck
